document.title: Alberta Ministry of Education- Social Studies Kindergarten through Grade 12

B3B9528A98264D2FA94BCC1EDAF8A88C.description:
analyze the impact of television, the Internet, radio and print media on a particular current
affairs issue

EC2FED5E55E744DC8156C978F67BEA42.description: examine the values, lifestyles and points of view represented in a media message

AA5F6B7E968544E3A3C9C02CCFF4A813.description: examine techniques used to enhance the authority and authenticity of media messages

59AAA69B78074DC396EDE158418552EE.description: listen to others to understand their points of view

70E2D109EE0440CC96E9203CD099C24B.description: offer reasoned comments related to a topic of discussion

5A4DB7C48DAB4E3B8708E905FA49673E.description:
elicit, clarify and respond appropriately to questions, ideas and multiple points of view
presented in discussions

93EFBDF81D9D48698DC90DE9B97C0324.description: use skills of informal debate to persuasively express differing viewpoints regarding an issue

B169CD01CED24A22A9939CF1B170FD39.description:
communicate in a persuasive and engaging manner through speeches, multimedia
presentations and written and oral reports, taking particular audiences and purposes into
consideration

F8C376A8C13140228FBAAC8B216F9207.description: demonstrate skills of oral, written and visual literacy:

F913133464E54849BAF2A8406622FDA2.description: ->access and retrieve information through the electronic network

9B4ACEABE2B54182867619CB202A272A.description: ->analyze and synthesize information to create a product

EE827312ECEE4D729791F464B6BBCC47.description: ->refine searches to limit sources to a manageable number

A88FDB2B74224E5DB6913A2372C73C32.description:
->make connections among related, organized data, and assemble various pieces into a unified
message

108ADF26F0BC452692E9CEB900F3D500.description: ->evaluate the relevance of electronically accessed information to a particular topic

333ADF5056FD42C19C4DE410603FDF3D.description:
->develop a process to manage volumes of information that can be made available through
electronic sources

BFC30F6D34DF492781C58B407EB25C94.description:
->demonstrate the advanced search skills necessary to limit the number of hits desired for
online and offline databases; for example, the use of “and” or “or” between search topics and
the choice of appropriate search engines for the topic

9F84F67CF59845129944545EB00CA064.description: ->plan and conduct a search, using a wide variety of electronic sources

8C6E01D834034B9A8A041DA804A4C0FE.description: include and organize references as part of research

41D41DF6B9704704A55B4B0ED52F81E7.description: practise the responsible and ethical use of information and technology

8858CBCBD6B44029878D3BDB87784654.description: formulate new questions as research progresses

A29125C1675F45408C5EAEB64C6E78CD.description:
determine how information serves a variety of purposes and that the accuracy or relevance of
information may need verification

D7AAC43B32F14999A93BF7C0585AE6D3.description: draw conclusions based upon research and evidence

BBC117C5985D488D8B0398DF4AD04114.description: develop a position that is supported by information gathered through research

BAB64990A3F74977BABD647D03D2B503.description:
integrate and synthesize concepts to provide an informed point of view on a research question
or an issue

98215045AA1348BFB3EA6BF923E9F212.description:
volunteer with organizations, projects and activities that ensure the growth and vitality of
their community

20115A44276F46989085D112787A1C72.description:
develop age-appropriate behaviour for social involvement as responsible citizens
contributing to their community:

05EA5F81C28B4AFF8AE0AD341DCAFE2D.description: ->access, retrieve and share information from electronic sources, such as common files

DD0707ADBBFF4FFE8FA93A4113C7D1C0.description: demonstrate leadership within groups where appropriate

AC53DA3871B34A38AC4F86FB67C8BD9D.description: consider the needs and perspectives of others

02D18EC4921440CDA7917DCCA9D0DC40.description: identify and use a variety of strategies to resolve conflicts peacefully and fairly

CDBFE52F9655468A9900A584EAF5ECF5.description: demonstrate skills of cooperation, conflict resolution and consensus building:

8DB8D3C470DD4BD28E996BC4FF630B4B.description: SOCIAL PARTICIPATION AS A DEMOCRATIC PRACTICE

DFA3FC68C1F04747B4F40851A6C3E194.description: ->use networks to brainstorm, plan and share ideas with group members

6332E256C3F143BA868798773A36ED3E.description:
->evaluate choices and the progress in problem solving, then redefine the plan of action as
appropriate

AD946EEB058A45CBA131BDB6FEC0FB5F.description: ->identify the appropriate materials and tools to use in order to accomplish a plan of action

BFEC124439D14A58A6ED83B71BDE1AC7.description: ->articulate clearly a plan of action to use technology to solve a problem

4B433037217B4E8892305C62E217AF40.description: participate in and predict outcomes of problem-solving and decision-making scenarios

67BE763990634A05934F32CB2C8A1B86.description: propose and apply strategies or options to solve problems and deal with issues

2A6D69F29B454C3DBB48B8174EDCE9E3.description:
propose and apply new ideas and strategies, supported with facts and reasons, to contribute to
problem solving and decision making

E839774BB2704D1DB23A9CAFD8E7BA31.description: demonstrate skills of compromise and devise strategies to reach group consensus

BA40F9DCF6F54ECEA85CEB5AFB75289A.description: demonstrate skills of decision making and problem solving:

B918A08B587C427387A65BF03727E402.description:
->access and operate multimedia applications and technologies from stand-alone and online
sources; e.g., GIS

C1F0F8C2B381468288ED933EB53047BF.description:
use geographic tools, such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software, to assist in
preparing graphs and maps

4DEF5B9092634F7CBAC9077CCD9A1E01.description: define geographic problems and issues and pose geographic questions

FA374E3CA14447FDA34E455F5CA6E824.description: construct and interpret various maps to broaden understanding of given topics

DB5B3BCAE1424D72B5466F5D8BCE822C.description: use thematic maps to describe cultural and political regions

A92A7C2695BC403DA4F9CDD9410E2C57.description: interpret historical maps to broaden understanding of historical events

A592F974B3BA4F89B1F52ECFD2BE33E6.description: ->create a simulation or a model by using technology that permits the making of inferences

704A7AAB1E5449CB94FB6CBABE493B43.description: analyze the historical contexts of key events of a given time period

5B29C56E90B7432996AEB5F35667995A.description: use historical and community resources to organize the sequence of historical events

B680BB0C3A594A48B0870EA147D0D488.description: distinguish cause, effect, sequence and correlation in historical events, including the longand short-term causal relations

9D1CCBC1D1A04D72AEDEADE1EBEBF27F.description: ->access diverse viewpoints on particular topics by using appropriate technologies

56646F72187C4B49884091D905D0E621.description: generate creative ideas and strategies in individual and group activities

B7254583E03B4BA9A793DF88A06D916D.description: re-evaluate personal opinions to broaden understanding of a topic or an issue

A07F819D959C46F1B3CA33C590400CED.description: demonstrate the ability to analyze local and current affairs

CC1DA7CE9C364BCABC96994C350057A0.description: evaluate ideas, information and positions from multiple perspectives

7208ABB2253D48148F6EB984CCFB3F75.description:
analyze the validity of information based on context, bias, source, objectivity, evidence and
reliability to broaden understanding of a topic or an issue

6727092FFA1B4668A1B1D3D55898C907.description: develop skills of critical thinking and creative thinking:

12A5F59668C04B04A754F52BE2DA4983.description:
SKILLS AND PROCESSES FOR GRADE 8: Alberta Education’s Information and Communication Technology (ICT) curriculum is infused throughout
the social studies program of studies. Selected ICT outcomes are suggested throughout the program and
are indicated by this symbol ->

CDA51CBFB209447999FCD4A05CE2871A.description:
To what extent were the divergent worldviews of the Spanish and Aztecs factors in the
dominance of one nation over the other? (TCC, CC, GC, PADM)

AA91C4ACD6534D35A72F7AA13B615BC1.description:
In what ways did factors such as technology and disease contribute to the dominance of the
Spanish over the Aztec civilization? (ER, LPP)

FF0FBA035CB645CE9510FA6237F7DD9E.description:
What key elements of Spain’s worldview led to the desire to expand the Spanish empire?
(TCC, I, PADM)

40899DE328F04ECBB6C95A4331EEE45D.description:
How did the Aztec civilization’s worldview influence the Aztecs’ choices, decisions and
customs? (TCC, CC, PADM)

31D5010EA6A6446E8B2CC3A0B2991E9A.description:
What were the key elements of the worldview of the Aztec civilization prior to contact with
the Spanish? (TCC, I, CC)

6602C09898CF435EA053C2442ED58EC3.description:
assess, critically, how the Aztecs were affected by the Spanish worldview by exploring and
reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

EDCCE85299614CF6933843C11CF36500.description:
appreciate and recognize how rapid adaptation can radically change a society’s beliefs,
values and knowledge (TCC, GC)

DB01E805B78349469941984A5CE3C4CB.description:
appreciate how Aztec and Spanish identities and worldviews were affected by intercultural
contact (TCC, GC, I)

6B5B9CA30FF14AC29BC8478FDE62C7D3.description:
appreciate how a society’s worldview influences the society’s choices, decisions and
interactions with other societies (C, I)

0651E0ACA3CE49A0B2BB19DB5E63086D.description:
Worldviews in Conflict: The Spanish and the Aztecs- General Outcome: Through an examination of Spanish and Aztec societies, students will demonstrate an understanding and
appreciation of how intercultural contact affects the worldviews of societies.

B2F3931814B0472BB0F7709C8358239D.description:
In what ways did exploration and intercultural contact during the Renaissance affect the
citizenship and identity of Europeans? (C, I, GC, LPP, TCC)

DD7302698D694F1DA61680B10FCBD03B.description:
In what ways were the Age of Discovery and the rise of imperialism expressions of an
expansionist worldview? (TCC, PADM, LPP)

4DFA75337D51461EA8FC171FDC526131.description:
In what ways did thinkers and philosophers influence society in the development of a
humanist worldview during the Renaissance? (GC, I)

050DDACC4A7647EBB8FF2B47CE94C20E.description:
How did increased trade lead to the emergence of powerful city-states (i.e., Florence,
Venice, Genoa)? (TCC, CC, ER)

4482D4B75E1B490CA73AB781884112C0.description:
How did the physical geography of Renaissance Europe affect trade and competition among
European countries? (LPP, TCC)

234977CB477345F982FF73CEF79BE30A.description:
How did the Renaissance spark the growth and exchange of ideas and knowledge across
Europe (i.e., astronomy, mathematics, science, politics, religion, arts)? (TCC, ER, PADM,
GC)

6DB1746BBD03477F97CFDE7FC0EC2BC2.description:
examine, critically, the factors that shaped the worldview evolving in western Europe
during the Renaissance by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and
issues:

E89D3B8121FD466B989FB2C98D2D404F.description:
recognize how beliefs and values are shaped by time, geographic location and societal
context (C, TCC, LPP)

943E129D398D4EEB87BCCBC84813A6EF.description: demonstrate a willingness to consider differing beliefs, values and worldviews (C, I)

DA63270FAB9246AF8AF5ABD236FBE1A1.description:
appreciate how Renaissance Europe formed the basis for the worldview of the Western
world (C, TCC)

EC1BB09ACA0E4BC3BF4454D2D2AED0E3.description:
Origins of a Western Worldview: Renaissance Europe- General Outcome: Through an examination of Renaissance Europe, students will demonstrate an understanding and
appreciation of how the exchange of ideas and knowledge contributed to shaping the worldview of the
Western world.

B570ED5CDB554936B5C1DC0254AC8281.description:
What challenges emerged for the Japanese in maintaining traditional cultural aspects of their
society while undergoing rapid change? (CC, I, TCC)

7CFDD6B724484A79872DFD492541EEA1.description:
In what ways did changes resulting from isolation in the Edo period compare to changes
resulting from adaptation in the Meiji period? (CC, TCC, I)

1193D85324E44EAAB24309D20B514ACE.description:
How did the changes resulting from adaptation affect Japan economically, politically and
socially during the Meiji period? (ER, CC, PADM)

D24268C34B5B4406B098594D34BA6FD5.description:
How did Japan adapt to changes brought on by the transition from feudal to modern models
of organization? (CC, TCC, I)

963C0661522348608B565EE46CBDE950.description:
What were the motivations for the radical changes in Japan’s model of organization during
the Meiji period? (ER, CC, PADM)

E79FCD67C00E4A34AC7BF09904198CC7.description:
analyze the effects that rapid adaptation had on traditionally isolated Japan during the
Meiji period by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

5620A4FE627E4EE893F399D504688F4E.description:
How did the shogun use the feudal system and the hierarchical social classes to maintain
control of Japan? (PADM, CC)

1C4A7D3D3E59483EBE330A5B5902DE64.description: How did the physical geography of Japan affect its worldview? (LPP, PADM, TCC)

C9571802BA554AC0A7976D80FF9EAF17.description:
How did the changes resulting from isolation affect Japan economically, politically and
socially during the Edo period? (ER, PADM, CC, I)

8709CF582815422CA6C244B1325665CB.description: How did isolation during the Edo period lead to changes in Japan? (CC, PADM)

4BBC144594DB49CD83B29091F45DCCA5.description: In what ways did Japan isolate itself from the rest of the world? (PADM, LPP, CC)

A6A07BD3CE974C51858FEA225208D6A3.description:
analyze the effects of cultural isolation during the Edo period by exploring and reflecting
upon the following questions and issues:

20734BB5B3DC4CD891FDA7758F591968.description: appreciate how a society’s worldview shapes individual citizenship and identity (C, I, TCC)

31DEC24EE5B34BED9B5F906D466F707B.description:
appreciate how models of governance and decision making reflect a society’s worldview
(C, I, TCC, PADM)

AF023FB160474B85832333BC237BC7FB.description:
appreciate how a society’s worldview can foster the choice to remain an isolated society
(C, I, TCC)

AB90AB8906E7489DAA084357CF2D8183.description:
appreciate the roles of time and geographic location in shaping a society’s worldview
(C, I, TCC, LPP)

DA1C2616426C4298A789920B820AD90F.description:
From Isolation to Adaptation: Japan-General Outcome: Through an examination of Japan, students will demonstrate an understanding and appreciation of the
ways in which beliefs, values and knowledge shape worldviews and contribute to a society’s isolation or
adaptation.
